 topi' () is a hat worn predominantly by the Sindhi people of Sindh, but also by
 the Baloch people and Saraiki people. Along with the ajrak, the Sindhi cap is
 regarded as an essential part of Sindhi culture and a symbol of Sindhi
 nationalism.

The hat is circular/cylindrical except for a portion cut out in the front to
expose the forehead. Intricate geometrical designs are embroidered on the hat,
and very often small pieces of mirror are sewed into it also.

In Sindhi culture, the Sindhi cap is often given as a gift or as a sign of
respect, along with the ajrak.

In December 2009, "Sindhi Cap Day" was celebrated in Pakistan's Sindh province
to celebrate the Sindhi cap, and Sindhi culture in general. In 2010, the day was
renamed to Sindhi Cultural Day.
